address: 50 Park Ter W APT 6B, New York, NY 10034
description:
For sale: $419,000. ALL THAT AND THEN SOME! This is the ultimate 1BR/1BA that literally checks off each box on a discerning home buyer's list: top floor, generous layout, beautiful light, open views, exquisite period details, and lovely renovations. If it's perfection you're after, you've just found it!



There's an immediate sense of space when you walk in with the foyer opening to an expansive sunken living room, complete with lovely wrought iron railings and intricate woodwork around the deco arch. The kitchen with a large eat-in area has been tastefully renovated with warm cherry wood cabinetry and open shelving, and features stainless appliances. The bathroom is a charming throwback where the beautifully maintained original features have been matched with period appropriate upgrades. The huge bedroom with enchanting morning light through a corner window has two exposures and two closets. Other deco details include stunning herringbone/hardwood floors with inlays, a unique full-size built-in bookshelf, and picture moldings throughout - folks, this is simply pure charm!



The location of this art deco jewel is in one word ideal, being surrounded by parks on one of the quietest blocks of NYC, yet close to all the amenities and transportation - pretty and convenient, all in one package. Never again be bothered by noisy upstairs neighbors, so get ready to enjoy morning sunrises and quiet evenings in your new home....



NB: There is a capital assessment of $158.32/mo until 3/2021.



This fantastic nabe has great outdoor opportunities, providing easy access to tennis, basketball, and handball courts, baseball and soccer fields, hiking/biking trails, and kayaking. It boasts the best dog run of the city (according to many) and is a nature-loving city-dweller's fantasy fulfilled. The local services include a year-round farmer's market, cafes and restaurants, banks, florists, and hardware stores; River Plaza shopping center with Target, Marshall's, etc. is within a quick walking distance. Inwood is serviced by A express and 1 local subway lines, Metro North (Marble Hill), and the east-side express bus to lower Manhattan, and is easily accessible by most major highways.



EXCLUSIVE AGENT: ACCESS PROPERTY GROUP

address: 90 Park Ter E APT 7H, New York, NY 10034
description:
For sale: $249,000. VIEWS 'TIL TOMORROW! Wake up with the first rays of the rising sun with open, urban views over the eastern horizon and even a distant peek of lower Manhattan - all at a price that's unheard of in today's day and age. If you've been looking for an opportunity to get your foot in the door with home buying, you just hit a jackpot!



This darling top-floor Studio/1BA is in perfect move-in condition, having been gut-renovated a few years ago. The compact, yet highly functional kitchen has all the features that an aspiring home chef might desire: lovely wood cabinetry offering great storage, sleek black granite counters, and all stainless steel appliances, including a dishwasher and a microwave. You can enjoy long and relaxing baths in the earthtone-tiled bathroom that will surely calm your nerves and take you to a zen place far away from the craziness of the city. This home has skim-coated walls and newly refinished original parquet floors throughout, and three closets offer plenty of storage for your belongings.



In addition to being the ideal first purchase, this home also makes a fabulous pied-a-terre because of its extra low maintenance resulting in VERY attractive monthly payments. Come and see this gem now, and be prepared to fall in love....



This fantastic nabe has great outdoor opportunities, providing easy access to tennis, basketball, and handball courts, baseball and soccer fields, hiking/biking trails, and kayaking. It boasts the best dog run of the city (according to many) and is a nature-loving city-dweller's fantasy fulfilled. The local services include a year-round farmer's market, cafes and restaurants, banks, florists, and hardware stores; River Plaza shopping center with Target, Marshall's, etc. is within a quick walking distance. Inwood is serviced by A express and 1 local subway lines, Metro North (Marble Hill), and the east-side express bus to lower Manhattan, and is easily accessible by most major highways.

address: 65 Park Ter E APT C58, New York, NY 10034
description:
For sale: $425,000. Gorgeous garden views from EVERY ROOM!! Yes, even the bathroom.

This 1 Bedroom with thoughtful layout, available on a high floor, in a well cared for Pre War elevator building is calling to you. Original oak hardwood floors in a herringbone pattern flow seamlessly throughout the apartment. All of the doors and knobs are original and filled with charm and history.

As you enter the foyer with large coat closet, its clear youve entered into a special space. The draw to the windows is unmistakable; its that view, the quiet and the flood of sunshine that makes you feel at home. A gracious sunken living room with the original wrought iron handrails is a great spot to gather with friends and family.

The kitchen offers granite countertops with custom stone backsplash and lots of working space. A wine rack, dishwasher and black slate floors should not be overlooked. The king size Bedroom offers 2 closets and a beautiful bay window to watch the snowfall stick to the trees in the garden. Charming, inviting and spacious, this apartment has to be seen to be fully appreciated.

Park Terrace Gardens features include: roof deck, free high-speed internet, concierge services, bike storage, laundry and so much more. 

The neighborhood features two parks with over 200 acres of woodland. Transportation couldn't be better. Two subway lines (the A and #1 trains), express bus and Metro North station are all conveniently located. Great parks, terrific transportation, convenient shopping, restaurants, Saturday's farmer's market and so much more - Come see what home feels like in Inwood!

address: 95 Park Ter E APT 4F, New York, NY 10034
description:
For sale: $399,999. Spacious, sunny, corner, Art Deco one bedroom at 95 PTE.  This unit has has the best layout you'll find in this price range.  When you enter the large foyer, which could easily double as a dining area, you're greeted by a beautiful imported French Art Deco cut-glass, hanging light and built-in shelves.In front of you, a lovely decorative arch and scrolling banisters lead you into a big, light-filled, sunken living room.



Two windows with southern exposure overlook quiet, tree-lined 217th street.The windowed eat-in kitchen, also off the foyer, has more lovely pre-war details, like a chair rail, as well as an installed water filter. Have your meals in the eat-in area while looking through another archway to a beautiful tree right outside.At the foyer's end, pass through another arch to the hallway, leading to the bathroom and bedroom.



The windowed bathroom has a new pedestal sink and newly tiled shower body as well as the original over-sized soaking tub.The generous bedroom has both eastern and southern exposures.

This apartment has lots of character with its red oak hardwood floors inlaid with walnut marquetry, crown and picture moldings, high ceilings and curved walls.



It also has 4 closets, one of which is a walk-in and updated electric. And it's steps from Inwood's renowned parks and nature trails, both the 1 and A trains, a Saturday Green Market as well as Inwood's community activities and concerts.



Sorry no dogs.

address: 77 Park Ter E APT D19, New York, NY 10034
description:
For sale: $269,000. Feels like a one bedroom at a price that cant be beat! Apartments like this rarely come on the market. Park Terrace Gardens, Inwoods most sought after cooperative, only has 4 studios in the entire 400 unit complex. Great opportunity for you to purchase in this most desirable complex at an affordable entry-level.

Very large and living area with a full size open kitchen. The living area has been divided with a wonderful storage solution giving you privacy, separation and still plenty of room. The apartment looks out over the front gardens and across the way are beautiful Tudor style homes built in the 1920s. This is one of the prettiest blocks in all of Manhattan.
There is a very large entry foyer and a separate dressing are. Tons of storage.
The building offers: free high speed internet access, concierge services, roof deck, on-site management, laundry room, and so much more.

address: 75 Park Ter E # D70, Manhattan, NY 10034
description:
For sale: $629,000. Inwood Two-Bedroom with Spectacular View

This sunny, open and professionally renovated 2 bedroom, one bath co-op on the 7th floor is the best the neighborhood has to offer! The skyline goes on forever from this elegant Pre-War two-bedroom in Inwoods coveted Park Terrace Gardens Coop. This apartment has been gorgeously renovated from floor to ceiling with modern kitchen and bathroom, while maintaining its natural charm.

The luxury kitchen has been updated to include every detail including new cabinetry, hardwood flooring, under cabinet storage drawers and top of the line integrated appliances. Features include a full-sized Sub Zero refrigerator/freezer with built-in ice-maker, integrated Viking Designer series cooktop with Viking Professional range hood, Viking oven, ultra quiet Bosch dishwasher, Water chef premium water filtration system, Grohe faucet, Waveline mosaic pure silk glass tile backsplash, 2 thick White Carrara honed marble countertops, under-cabinet lighting, above-cabinet lighting and installed microwave. Other wonderful details include an extended breakfast bar adding nearly two additional feet of cooking/ dining space in the kitchen, integrated shelving with drawers for storage and a spice pantry.

The impeccably renovated bathroom boasts clean, modern lines and is simply luxurious. The 2017 gut renovation includes 1/2" thick herringbone marble tile floors, gleaming porcelain floor to ceiling wall tiles, Rejuvenation Tolson thermostatic shower set with hand-shower in aged brass, Rejuvenation Tolson faucet and handles, Kohler Santa Rosa toilet, Kohler double mirrored vanity/medicine cabinet, and Ronbow vanity with soft-close doors.

The open living space features a sunken living room, dining foyer, George Kovacs ceiling fan/light fixture and expansive views, from miles of open sky to a charming, tree-lined street showcasing Inwood's row of Tudor-style homes. Other amazing Art Deco features include wrought iron railings and built-in recessed bookshelves, highlighted by herringbone hardwood floors and beamed ceilings.

The welcoming master bedroom and second bedroom are full-sized rooms that get amazing morning sunlight. The master room updates include a George Kovacs light and fan and 10.5 feet of floor to ceiling wardrobe added for additional closet space. This wardrobe also features glass doors that serve as a very convenient whiteboard.

Park Terrace Gardens has an on-site management office, 24-hour laundry room, concierge service, free Internet and rooftop common areas for BBQs and entertaining. This unit is in an amazing and friendly neighborhood with the majestic 196-acre Inwood Hill Park within walking distance. Come see the perfect place to call home!

address: 730 Fort Washington Ave APT 3H, New York, NY 10040
description:
For sale: $899,000. Perfection is the key!
Sprawling renovated Two Bedrooms/ Two Bath apartment in one of Hudson Heights most sought-after buildings. As soon as you step into this home you will be amazed at the size of the rooms. A large dining Foyer flows into the huge sunken Living room with Eastern-facing windows and wide open city views. Wonderful hardwood floors, loads of closet space and 8.9 foot ceilings.
The renovated eat-in kitchen with a breakfast counter has a stainless steel appliances and tons of cabinet storage and counter space for meal prepping. It is large enough for festive gatherings. The spacious master bedroom is beautifully accented with a large corner window opening to dramatic panoramas of Fort George Hill. The second bedroom has two large closets and can easy fit a queen size bed. The second windowed bathroom is also renovated with a nice sink and medicine cabinet.
The amenities in the building include fitness club ($240/yr), storage facilities(WL), two laundry rooms, private courtyard garden, two bicycle rooms and a security guard(PT).Situated only a few steps from majestic Fort Tryon Park with famous vistas of the George Washington Bridge spanning the Hudson River, three seasonal gardens, wooded promenades, terraces, eight miles of pedestrian paths and the world famous Cloisters Museum (part of the Metropolitan Museum of Art).
This terrific property is nearby playgrounds, parks, restaurants, shops, schools and parking garages. The A train is steps away to take you to Midtown in 20 minutes. 
Pets are welcome

address: 245 Bennett Ave APT 4B, New York, NY 10040
description:
For sale: $565,000. *SUN-DRENCHED 2 Bedroom! 10% Down Allowed!*
Located on the corner of 192nd & Bennett Ave, a cozy tree-lined side street away from Broadway where the beautifully preserved big old trees surrounds this home along with the Majestic Cliff. This true 2 Bedroom home has south and East exposure, with over-sized windows in every single room makes this home extremely bright though out the day. There are 3 different 2BR layouts in this well-established 350 Unit Co-op, and this is the BIGGEST of all. 

This lofty and airy layout allow you to convert this 2 Bedroom into a 3 bedroom by installing windowed French doors dividing at the living room, which could be perfect for the guest room(will hold the full size bed) or office. 

Absolutely move-in condition, this property was completely renovated with skilled craftsmanship only a few years ago. The hardwood floors are in superior condition, walls are all skim-coated and both ceiling and flooring have elegant wood crown molding throughout. The windowed Kitchen has a gorgeous one-slab granite counter top. This kitchen is equipped with all stainless steel appliances, including a full size fridge, a full size dishwasher and the faucet has pull-down sprayer feature for quick sink wash. There are plenty of cabinetry and counter surfaces. This unit offers fabulous closet space. Both of the bedrooms are large and almost equal in sizes; there will be plenty of room left after placing your complete set of bedroom furniture!
 
There are two major subway lines very close by (Express A line is on the same block, 1 line is one block away). This financially sold coop is offering affordable low maintenance, 24/7 laundry facility, bike room, manicured flower garden, resident super and porters. The coop allows both dogs and cats-with no weight restriction and 90% financing allowed! 245 Bennett Avenue is situated in the heart of Hudson heights, next to the breath-taking Fort Tryon Park with Hudson River views!

address: 4489 Broadway APT 5C, New York, NY 10040
description:
For sale: $399,000. *MINT CONDITION ONE BEDROOM NEAR FORT TRYON PARK* 
This pristine high floor home has been newly refreshed to absolute perfection. Simply move in and start making memories. Filled with glorious light and pretty leafy views, this gem offers an ideal layout for ease of living and entertaining. The tastefully renovated kitchen has plentiful cabinet space, granite counters with subway tile back splash, stainless full-sized appliances and a large open breakfast bar. The living room is also quite generous, accommodating both conversation area plus dining or home office. The bedroom boasts 2 exposures and plenty of space for a king bed and more. The bathroom is done in marble tile with travertine inlay, pedestal sink and a triple medicine cabinet for all your storage needs. Throughout you'll find great closets, crown moldings, beautiful hardwood floors, upgraded electric and custom cellular shades. The super LOW MAINTENANCE is an added bonus! 

Situated in Fort Tryon Gardens, a large, well-run Co-operative with central laundry, bike storage, private storage, resident super and community gardens. 

This pet-friendly building is located at the foothills of glorious Fort Tryon Park, where a short hike up a wooded pathway brings you to a scenic overlook with panoramic views of the Hudson River and Palisades. Just a few minutes from the Cloisters Museum. Within a few-block radius of the apartment are more than a dozen restaurants and bars in addition to a wide variety of groceries, banks, drugstores and services including a gym. The 1 train and A express train are both just across the street. If you long for a greener quality of life without leaving Manhattan, this is your sweet-spot; it's THE destination neighborhood for savvy buyers seeking more space, more serenity and more value.

address: 360 Cabrini Blvd APT 3D, New York, NY 10040
description:
For sale: $595,000. This Junior-4 is the one you've been waiting for! With a 2nd bedroom already created, this inviting corner apartment flaunts a spacious sunken living room, a sizable dining foyer for elegant entertaining, a large master bedroom with dual exposures, inlaid hardwood floors, a windowed bathroom, new high-performance windows (thermal double-pane, double-hung aluminum windows with easy-lift balances), 9-foot ceilings, excellent storage space, an incredibly reasonable monthly maintenance that includes gas, and a beautifully renovated kitchen with gleaming granite countertops, attractive custom cabinetry, and high-end stainless steel appliances including a Bosch dishwasher, oven, microwave, and French door refrigerator. To top it all off, you are just a 20-minute subway commute from Columbus Circle!



Situated in a tranquil residential oasis on the banks of the Hudson River, 360 Cabrini Boulevard is well-maintained, elevator-serviced co-op with excellent financials, a live-in super, and a part-time doorman (4pm-midnight, 7 days a week). Both pets and up to 80% financing are permitted. Residents enjoy a lovely Art Deco lobby, landscaped and furnished common courtyard, storage room, separate air conditioner storage room, bicycle room, newly renovated laundry room, and $55.60 per month bulk rate package that includes cable, Showtime, and high speed internet! 360 Cabrini Boulevard is a green building that participates in every recycling program that NYC has to offer including but not limited to EcycleNYC (electronics recycling), composting, and ReFashion NYC (clothing and accessory recycling). 



Transportation is a breeze with the A train nearly at your doorstep, the 1 train not much further, as well as the express M98 and M4 bus lines. Best of all is having Fort Tyron Park as your backyard! Enjoy its 8 miles of pathways, multiple lawns, Manhattan's largest garden (Heather Garden, which boasts over 500 varieties of plants, trees, and shrubs), the Cloisters, a branch of the Metropolitan Museum of Art that houses nearly 5,000 medieval works, the lauded New Leaf Restaurant & Bar, Manhattan's largest dog run, two playgrounds, volleyball courts, built-in ping pong tables, and unparalleled views of the sparkling Hudson River!

address: 360 Cabrini Blvd APT 6F, New York, NY 10040
description:
For sale: $558,000. Welcome home to this exquisite, beautifully maintained Pre-War one-bedroom co-op apartment in Hudson Heights. Upon entering the corner home, you will be greeted by an astonishing, open dining foyer that leads to the renovated kitchen with tasteful shaker wood cabinets, stainless steel appliances, and stone counters. There is even a large alcove for a desk! This airy and welcoming apartment faces north and west with beautiful light throughout the day. The elegant and spacious sunken living room has ample room for gatherings and relaxation. The windowed, eat-in kitchen overlooks the verdant boundary of Fort Tryon Park with an abundance of nature and quiet. The corner bedroom is large and cheerful with two exposures and two closets-with seasonal river views in the cooler months and lovely park views during the warmer months, you will have the best of both. There are 4 closets in total. The restored, windowed bathroom is in excellent condition. This exceptional home is one not to miss! There is a $96.88/month assessment for boiler conversion. 

360 Cabrini Boulevard, built in 1939 with 110 units, is one of the finest examples of Art Deco style architecture located in Hudson Heights. This impeccably maintained co-op is adjacent to Fort Tryon Park with vistas of the Palisades and the George Washington Bridge, and is a short distance to The Met Cloisters Museum. The building amenities include: storage room (wait list and extra fee), new state-of-the-art laundry room, interior garden and seating areas, bicycle room (extra fee), part-time doorman (4PM to 11PM, 7 days per week), live-in super, porter, and a handyman. The building recently installed new, energy efficient windows (2018). The co-op is pet friendly. The A-subway line is minutes away, as are the M-4 and the M-98 bus lines, which are one block away. The 1-line is located on St. Nicholas Avenue. Nearby are shops, restaurants, cafe's, banks, supermarkets, pharmacy, cleaners, spas, hardware store, and other essential services. A great building in a friendly neighborhood with all the amenities that you will need is just minutes away. 80% financing permitted.
